transcription.text:
Speaker 1: Hi, this is Viagra.

Speaker 2: I'm sorry, what was your name again, please?

Speaker 1: Ollie speaking, Viagra score blue, Mr. Brian Johnson.

Speaker 2: Yes, did you say your name is Ollie?

Speaker 1: Ollie, yeah.

Speaker 2: Well, Mr. Ollie, I had an unauthorized purchase put on my credit card.

Speaker 1: I did a one-time purchase, and y'all charged my card and sent medicine that I did not request.

Speaker 2: I need a refund.

Speaker 1: Okay, let me pull your prescription here.

Speaker 2: All right, Mr. Johnson, yes, I see that you have a prescription for Viagra.

Speaker 1: No, I do not have a prescription.

Speaker 2: I have a prescription.

Speaker 1: I purchased a one-time purchase,

Speaker 2: and I did not authorize y'all to charge my credit card any time you wanted to.

Speaker 1: It was a one-time purchase.

Speaker 2: Okay, sir, I'm going to help you with that.

Speaker 1: I've got to go over what I see on the screen, okay?

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: I've got to inform you about what's going on with your purchase

Speaker 2: and all the things work so you can understand better and we can resolve, okay?

Speaker 1: Well, the first thing is what you need to understand is this is a one-time purchase,

Speaker 2: so it doesn't matter what the system says.

Speaker 1: I'm telling you my card was unauthorized to be charged again.

Speaker 2: I heard that.

Speaker 1: And do you want me to help you so we can move forward?

Speaker 2: Well, why are you saying you've got to go over all this other stuff?

Speaker 1: Because that's protocol, sir.

Speaker 2: I've got to read what I see on your account,

Speaker 1: and then we're going to proceed with the issue that you have.

Speaker 2: So you have a prescription, right?

Speaker 1: Now, the doctor wrote it with refill.

Speaker 2: You order 40, you got an extra 40.

Speaker 1: So they usually order with refill, but because you get 40,

Speaker 2: you get it, I think, every 90 days.

Speaker 1: No, that's the problem.

Speaker 2: That's the problem.

Speaker 1: You said you think that I get it every 90 days.

Speaker 2: No, I do not.

Speaker 1: I told you this was a one-time purchase of what was on the screen.

Speaker 2: It was not a refill every other time that it comes up.

Speaker 1: That's the difference.

Speaker 2: I got you.

Speaker 1: So that was the way the thing was.

Speaker 2: That's why they process a refill.

Speaker 1: But if you don't need refill, you can return that one for your refund.

Speaker 2: That's not a problem, okay?

Speaker 1: You can write refuse return on it.

Speaker 2: You're going to get your full refund, okay?

Speaker 1: I was just trying to explain to you how the prescription was written,

Speaker 2: and then when you don't need it, like you said, it's a one-time,

Speaker 1: you can also order as needed.

Speaker 2: You can be like, hey, you know,

Speaker 1: I don't need the initial written prescription the way it was.

Speaker 2: Okay, okay, okay.

Speaker 1: I understand all that.

Speaker 2: But let me tell you something.

Speaker 1: Let me tell you something, okay?

Speaker 2: Yes, yes.

Speaker 1: How do I return these?

Speaker 2: Because your website, gogomed, I pulled it up,

Speaker 1: and it says the domain name is for sale.

Speaker 2: I couldn't even go to a login to a website.

Speaker 1: No, no, it's not gogomed2go.

Speaker 2: It's coreblue.com.

Speaker 1: You know, it's coreblue.com.

Speaker 2: Well, the document that came with the paperwork says gogomed,

Speaker 1: and it gives an email address.

Speaker 2: But you're saying this came from who, blue, what?

Speaker 1: No, no, no.

Speaker 2: So gogomed is our pharmacy.

Speaker 1: But a company you need to talk to for any adjustment that you need,

Speaker 2: like right now, refund is coreblue.com.

Speaker 1: Gogomed is just the name of our pharmacy.

Speaker 2: But for customer service-related question and issue, it's coreblue.com,

Speaker 1: and the phone number you're calling right now.

Speaker 2: You're in the right phone number.

Speaker 1: Like I said, the package you received that you say wasn't right,

Speaker 2: you want that refund, you just write two words on it.

Speaker 1: But listen to me.

Speaker 2: But when I filled out the application online,

Speaker 1: I filled it out as a one-time purchase, not an automatic refill,

Speaker 2: no auto refill.

Speaker 1: So somebody, if I'm not speaking to someone at blue.com right now?

Speaker 2: Yes, that's why we're going to refund.

Speaker 1: You're just returning and you're going to get your refund.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: So how do I send this?

Speaker 2: But what's the address I return this to?

Speaker 1: Do you still have the package it came with?

Speaker 2: Hello?

Speaker 1: Yeah, I'm trying to find it here.

Speaker 2: So who do I return?

Speaker 1: You have the package where it came with, the shipment package.

Speaker 2: But it doesn't have a name on it.

Speaker 1: Mr. Johnson, please listen to me.

Speaker 2: Do you have the package where it came with, the original package?

Speaker 1: Yes, I do.

Speaker 2: Yes, I do.

Speaker 1: So that package is very simple.

Speaker 2: The label that you see on top,

Speaker 1: find a space where you're going to write refuse return.

Speaker 2: Well, I didn't even know it was from you.

Speaker 1: I opened the package.

Speaker 2: I've already opened the package.

Speaker 1: That's fine.

Speaker 2: Try to close it nicely as you can,

Speaker 1: so that way you don't have to get another shipment package and pay for

Speaker 2: anything because we already paid for that one.

Speaker 1: Now you close it nicely.

Speaker 2: You open it because obviously you need to see that,

Speaker 1: oh, that don't belong to me.

Speaker 2: So the post office know that.

Speaker 1: Now you write refuse return because basically you're saying that you got

Speaker 2: delivered the wrong package and the mailman take that back to the source,

Speaker 1: which is the pharmacy where it came from.

Speaker 2: It's very simple.

Speaker 1: And when he take that, he's going to scan that package.

Speaker 2: And there is an original tracking number that we have in your account here.

Speaker 1: So when it's going back,

Speaker 2: we're going to see in that tracking number that the package is going back to

Speaker 1: the pharmacy for your refund.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: So now my next question is,

Speaker 2: is there any indication on your system that I'm going to be charged in the

Speaker 1: future again?

Speaker 2: Because this should not have happened in the first place.

Speaker 1: That's my point.

Speaker 2: This should not have happened.

Speaker 1: I charge against my account in the first place.

Speaker 2: So if I refuse to return it next month,

Speaker 1: they're going to ship it again because it's not.

Speaker 2: No, no, no.

Speaker 1: There is two things we're going to do today, Mr.

Speaker 2: Johnson.

Speaker 1: If you tell me you want to reorder yourself as needed,

Speaker 2: I'm going to ask the pharmacy to pause.

Speaker 1: So you're not going to have monthly refill or anything like that.

Speaker 2: You can order 10 pill once or twice a year.

Speaker 1: If you say, you know,

Speaker 2: going to need the VAG or in the future,

Speaker 1: we're just going to cancel your account.

Speaker 2: But in both scenarios, you're not going to get charged.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: That's what I want to do.

Speaker 1: That's what I want to do.

Speaker 2: I want to cancel my account.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: No problem.

Speaker 2: And then just write two words, refuse, return on the packet.

Speaker 1: We're going to refund you 163.95, a full refund.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: Yeah.

Speaker 1: All right.

Speaker 2: Now we're here to help you.

Speaker 1: If there is any mix-up, we're here to resolve.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: We're going to get you your refund.

Speaker 2: It's very simple.

Speaker 1: Two words on the packet, seal it nicely, send it back.

Speaker 2: 163.95, we'll be on your way.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: So now the next process, what do I have to do to cancel my account?

Speaker 2: I just canceled your account.

Speaker 1: You've done it.

Speaker 2: That's it.

Speaker 1: All right.

Speaker 2: Are you going to send me an email verification showing that?

Speaker 1: I can send you.

Speaker 2: I can give you a confirmation number, matter of fact, over the phone right now.

Speaker 1: That would be great.

Speaker 2: Please do so.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: Yeah.

Speaker 1: 482.

Speaker 2: 482.

Speaker 1: The letter A, the letter E.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: Nine, I mean, 095.

Speaker 2: 095.

Speaker 1: The letter B and the number two.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: Let me repeat this back to you.

Speaker 2: 482.

Speaker 1: 8E.

Speaker 2: 095B2.

Speaker 1: Yes.

Speaker 2: Exactly.

Speaker 1: And just return that package real quick.

Speaker 2: We'll get you your money back.

Speaker 1: No problem.

Speaker 2: 163.95.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: Nothing to worry about.

Speaker 1: We're here to assist.

Speaker 2: We have customer service for you at your service.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: Just to say it, let me make sure I got all this right.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: 482.

Speaker 2: So give me your telephone number.

Speaker 1: This is 1-800-675-9807.

Speaker 2: Is that correct?

Speaker 1: Yes.

Speaker 2: I want to be sure because I dialed a different phone number first.

Speaker 1: I dialed that go-go meds or whatever it was and couldn't get through to nobody.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: I believe I have everything now so I can send a copy of this back with them too.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: I believe I have everything now.

Speaker 2: All right.

Speaker 1: You're all set.

Speaker 2: Just return.

Speaker 1: Like I said, try to close it nicely.

Speaker 2: Make it look nice.

Speaker 2: You can leave it in your mailbox.

Speaker 1: Or you can take it and just throw it in the shipping box at the local post

Speaker 2: office location.

Speaker 1: And then, you know, the tracking number attached to the package we sent you

Speaker 2: is going to show us it's coming back.

Speaker 1: And then, you know, your refund is going to click in.

Speaker 2: You can follow up maybe four days after and check on, you know, the status.

Speaker 1: We get you a refund.

Speaker 2: And there's $163.95 and you'll be good to go.

Speaker 1: Your account is fully canceled.

Speaker 1: Okay.

Speaker 2: Thank you very much, Charlie.

Speaker 1: Yes.

Speaker 1: You have a good one, okay?

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: Good-bye.

Speaker 2: Bye-bye.
